description:
-Using a ziploc may limit the use to one time, and would have to be able to be resealed reliably with a double gloved hand....a slide lock bag may be more effective

-SPONGES partially loaded with water/amonia mix could also be placed in the zip loc bag to reduce the potential for liquid escaping the bag during the remains preparation or out pateient treatment.

Wondering what other simple inexpensive innovations could help reduce health care worker anxiety ? 
What are the key triggers of anixiety and how are health workers coping now ?
summary: Gloves may get exposed during out patient missions when workers are away from easy access to glove wash/disinfectant stations. A sturdy zip lot bag partially filled with water ammonia solution could be duct taped to outside of apron and utilised if worker feels anxiety of exposure. the goal would to be reduce anxiety and reduce possible contamination.
title: Portable Emergency Glove Disinfectant Bath> Potentially reduce anxiety of infection for heath workers who are working outside clinical/camp setting
